intro: Pavetta inconspicua, commonly known as the small pavetta, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its flowers are small, clustered in inflorescences, and usually have five petals. The leaves are simple, opposite, and often have a rough or hairy texture.
